intro: Botryanthus speciosus, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences that resemble spherical clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant produces palmate leaves with a velvety texture and emits a mild, sweet fragrance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Botryanthus speciosus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various climates.
